alert.note: Alert for Death Valley National Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 4:49AM PST until February 26 at 4:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Death Valley National Park. * WHEN...Through 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible over Towne Pass and other roads above 4000 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Watch for downed trees and powerlines as well.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
